channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: U.K.'s parliament had a rare debate about the royals
item.description: Something rare happened Tuesday in the U.K. Parliament: MPs criticized the royals, which 19th century rules prohibit. But an exception was made for disgraced ex-Prince Andrew — and floodgates opened.
item.content:encoded: Something rare happened Tuesday in the U.K. Parliament: MPs criticized the royals, which 19th century rules prohibit. But an exception was made for disgraced ex-Prince Andrew — and floodgates opened.
item.dc:creator: Lauren Frayer

item.title: Indian prime minister Modi is set to visit Israel at a perilous moment in time
item.description: The Indian prime minister will meet his Israeli counterpart in Israel this week amid a rapidly shifting geopolitical crisis.
item.content:encoded: The Indian prime minister will meet his Israeli counterpart in Israel this week amid a rapidly shifting geopolitical crisis.
item.dc:creator: Diaa Hadid

item.title: What presidents said during State of the Union when political winds were against them
item.description: Facing rough poll numbers, President Trump has a lot at stake for the State of the Union address. Here's how other presidents have handled the moment.
item.content:encoded: Facing rough poll numbers, President Trump has a lot at stake for the State of the Union address. Here's how other presidents have handled the moment.
item.dc:creator: Domenico Montanaro

item.title: Remembering actor Robert Carradine, a reluctant nerd on screen
item.description: The actor Robert Carradine, famous for roles in Revenge of the Nerds and Lizzie McGuire — among more serious parts — has died. He was 71.
item.content:encoded: The actor Robert Carradine, famous for roles in Revenge of the Nerds and Lizzie McGuire — among more serious parts — has died. He was 71.
item.dc:creator: Mia Venkat

item.title: Readers say goodbye to Book World from 'The Washington Post'
item.description: Fans of The Washington Post's now-canceled Book World section had a send-off for it last weekend. It was one of the last major sources of book reviews and recommendations for a general news audience.
item.content:encoded: Fans of The Washington Post's now-canceled Book World section had a send-off for it last weekend. It was one of the last major sources of book reviews and recommendations for a general news audience.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Limbong

item.title: Under social pressure, young clownfish lose their stripes faster, study finds
item.description: Tomato clownfish appear to adjust the stripes on their bodies in response to social pressures, a new study finds.
item.content:encoded: Tomato clownfish appear to adjust the stripes on their bodies in response to social pressures, a new study finds.
item.dc:creator: Ari Daniel

item.title: 'Relooted' is a game about repatriating art
item.description: In the new video game Relooted, players are asked to repatriate African artifacts from museums.
item.content:encoded: In the new video game Relooted, players are asked to repatriate African artifacts from museums.
item.dc:creator: Vincent Acovino

item.title: Will American shoppers get a tariff refund?
item.description: Americans paid for tariffs. They shouldn't expect their money back.
item.content:encoded: Americans paid for tariffs. They shouldn't expect their money back.
item.dc:creator: Stephan Bisaha

item.title: Podcaster Michael Knowles to Trump: Remind people you 'represent normal'
item.description: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly talks with conservative podcaster Michael Knowles, host of The Michael Knowles Show, about what he hopes to hear from President Trump tonight in the State of the Union.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly talks with conservative podcaster Michael Knowles, host of The Michael Knowles Show, about what he hopes to hear from President Trump tonight in the State of the Union.
item.dc:creator: Michael Levitt

item.title: Trump set to deliver SOTU address amid high stakes moment both at home and abroad
item.description: President Trump is expected to deliver a lengthy defense of the first year of his second term and make the case for his party ahead of the midterms in his speech Tuesday.
item.content:encoded: President Trump is expected to deliver a lengthy defense of the first year of his second term and make the case for his party ahead of the midterms in his speech Tuesday.
item.dc:creator: Danielle Kurtzleben
